page.title: 18CUTNALL GREEN MEMORIAL HALL
page.content: Flat roofed utility style building set in its own grounds, with car park and playing fields. Seating capacity 160 persons. It was opened in 1961. It is used for:- bingo, whist drives and over 60s club, each held fortnightly. Boy scouts and cubs meet weekly. Womans Institute and village hall committee each meet monthly in the hall. There is also an annual January supper with entertainment and a christmas party for the over 60s. The tennis, golf and cricket clubs use the adjoining fields regularly, with their own pavilion, and use the village hall occasionally for such things as annual dinners and dances. The hall is also hired out at various times. Most of the community use their local hall some frequently. Money is at present being raised to modernise the kitchen and toilets.
